solution_line_template: In one building, there are {total_stories} - {first_floor_count} = <<{total_stories}-{first_floor_count}={floors_with_five_units}>>{floors_with_five_units} floors that have 5 apartment units each.

Mr. Resty has a total of {floors_with_five_units} floors x {units_per_other_floor} units = <<{floors_with_five_units}*{units_per_other_floor}={units_from_other_floors_per_building}>>{units_from_other_floors_per_building} apartment units from the 2nd to 4th floor in one building.

So, in one building, there are a total of {units_from_other_floors_per_building} + {first_floor_units} = <<{units_from_other_floors_per_building}+{first_floor_units}={total_units_per_building}>>{total_units_per_building} apartment units.

Therefore, Mr. Resty has a total of {total_units_per_building} x {num_buildings} = <<{total_units_per_building}*{num_buildings}={total_units_all_buildings}>>{total_units_all_buildings} apartment units in his 2 buildings.
